TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MobileListItemCollection extends System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase implements class System.Web.UI.IStateManager

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects, and is used to hold the items of a control and a control. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List.Items%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> control or the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.Items%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList> control retrieves a MobileListItemCollection object. You can add or remove items from the collection at run time.
A MobileListItemCollection object inherits from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
## Examples The following code example shows how you manipulate items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object through the MobileListItemCollection class. The code uses the selected item's index into the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.Items%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
[!code-vb[MobileListItemSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.mobileco_5_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[MobileListItemSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.mobileco_5_1.aspx)]

Docs.permission: for operating in a hosted environment. Demand value: ; Permission value: .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this version of the constructor syntax to populate the new object with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> objects contained in the `items` parameter.

Docs.param: The item to add to the end of the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds an item to the end of a collection with the provided string as the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> property. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Creates a new list item with the specified text and then adds it to the end of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem item) cil managed

Docs.param: The item to add to the end of the collection.
Docs.summary: Adds an item to the end of a collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Depending on the syntax used, the Add method either adds the specified item to the end of the collection, or constructs a new list item with the specified text and then adds it to the end of the collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Add method to add an item named `_ml` to the end of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection>.
[!code-vb[MobileListItemSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/c713b9d0-487a-44c9-94c0-_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[MobileListItemSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/c713b9d0-487a-44c9-94c0-_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface.
You can use the Clear method for all the classes where this method applies. For example, the Clear method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection>, it clears all the choices in the collection.
Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.

Docs.param: An item to search for in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Gets the index of the specified item as an integer. If the specified item is not in the collection, the IndexOf method returns `-1`.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Insert (int index, string item);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Insert(int32 index, string item) cil managed

Docs.param: The item to be inserted into the list.
Docs.summary: Adds an item to the specified location in the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `index` value must be between 0 and the size of the collection. If `index` is the size of the collection, `item` is added to the end of the collection. This overload first creates a new <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object with the given string, and inserts this item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void TrackViewState() cil managed

Docs.summary: Instructs the collection to track changes to its view state. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks After this method has been called, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property will return `true`. Also, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager.IsTrackingViewState%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.IStateManager> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> will be set to `true`.
